item.title: Gates Foundation-backed program will soon be issuing home testing kits for COVID-19 in Seattle – TechCrunch
item.description: A project funded by the Gates Foundation will soon begin issuing at-home testing kits for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, according to a report in the Seattle Times. The study, based on a nose-swab should be able to return results in up to two days and will be shared with health officials who can …

item.description: I started thinking about ball juggling machines in the year 2015. I wrote about my first few attempts at creating them in this blog post from the year 2017. item.title: Google and HTTP
item.description: I've been writing about Google's efforts to deprecate HTTP, the protocol of the web. This is a summary of all the reasons why I am opposed to them doing this.

item.title: Cryptographic Signatures, Surprising Pitfalls, and LetsEncrypt
item.description:
The Let's Encrypt Accident On August 11th, 2015, Andrew Ayer posted the following email to the IETF mailing list:
I recently reviewed draft-barnes-acme-04 and found vulnerabilities in the DNS, DVSNI, and Simple HTTP challenges that would allow an attacker to fraudulently complete these challenges.
(The author has since then written a more complete explanation of the attack.) The draft-barnes-acm ...

item.title: My favourite Git commit
item.description: I like Git commit messages. Used well, I think they’re one of the most powerful tools available to document a codebase over its lifetime. I’d like to illustrate that by showing you my favourite ever Git commit.

item.title: Jim Scheinman TED Talk: The Amazing true story of Galen Clark, the "Father of Yosemite"
item.description: In this short TED Talk, Jim discusses the true meaning of finding one's passion and leaving one's legacy by weaving in the incredible untold true story of one of the key 'founders' of Yosemite, Galen Clark, an early pioneer and failed entrepreneur, who contracted tuberculosis while mining for gold and was told he had only months to live, yet who lived to 96 and is a key reason that we have the beauty of Yosemite to cherish today. Enjoy the journey and celebration of this soft-spoken true American hero, Galen Clark, as we celebrate the 150th Anniversary of Yosemite as National Treasure!
item.author: (Jim Scheinman)
